content: I experience this too. Taking a few slow breaths before speaking helps me settle my body a bit.
I remind myself that feeling anxious doesn’t mean I will perform badly. That thought alone reduces some pressure.
Yes, I relate. For me it helps to notice that moods can change even if nothing obvious caused them.
I try to stop checking my phone at least 30 minutes before bed. It doesn’t fix everything but helps a little.
I often assume the worst too. Writing down alternative explanations has helped me challenge that habit.
I relate a lot. Practicing small boundary statements first made it easier over time.
Mistakes stick with me too. I try to ask myself what I would say to a friend in the same situation.
Starting very small helped me. I aim for consistency rather than intensity.
